title: The Book of Kells
description: Illuminated manuscript containing the four Gospels of the New Testament, decorated with intricate and colorful illustrations.

title: The Bayeux Tapestry
description: Embroidered cloth depicting the events leading up to the Norman conquest of England, including the Battle of Hastings.

title: Chartres Cathedral
description: Gothic cathedral located in Chartres, France, renowned for its stained glass windows and architectural grandeur.

title: The Lindisfarne Gospels
description: Illuminated manuscript containing the Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, lavishly illustrated with intricate designs and patterns.

title: The Unicorn Tapestries
description: A series of woven tapestries depicting various scenes featuring unicorns, animals, and hunters, representing the medieval concept of chivalry and symbolism.

title: The Book of Hours of Jeanne d'Evreux
description: Lavishly illuminated manuscript prayer book commissioned by Queen Jeanne d'Evreux, featuring exquisite miniatures and decorative motifs.

title: The Hours of Catherine of Cleves
description: Illuminated manuscript book of hours owned by Catherine of Cleves, featuring intricate illustrations and miniatures depicting religious scenes and daily activities.

title: The Doors of Ghiberti
description: A pair of bronze doors for the Florence Baptistery, adorned with intricately sculpted biblical scenes and figures, showcasing the early Renaissance style.

title: The Westminster Retable
description: Painted altarpiece featuring scenes from the life of Christ, located in Westminster Abbey, London.

title: The Stavelot Triptych
description: Portable triptych made of wood and metal, featuring engraved biblical scenes and figures, possibly used for private devotion.

title: Mona Lisa
description: A renowned portrait of Lisa Gherardini, known as Mona Lisa, featuring a captivating smile and meticulous details.

title: The Last Supper
description: A mural painting depicting the final meal of Jesus with his disciples, known for its composition and perspective.

title: The Birth of Venus
description: A mythological painting depicting the birth of the goddess Venus, known for its graceful composition and ethereal beauty.

title: The Creation of Adam
description: A fresco painting on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel depicting the biblical creation of Adam, renowned for its iconic composition.

title: The School of Athens
description: A fresco painting depicting a gathering of ancient Greek philosophers, representing the pursuit of knowledge and philosophy.

title: The Creation of Eve
description: A panel painting on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel depicting the creation of Eve from the biblical story of Adam and Eve.

title: The Sistine Madonna
description: A religious painting depicting the Virgin Mary, with the Christ Child and saints, known for its soft colors and emotional impact.

title: The Last Judgment
description: A massive fresco painting on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel depicting the second coming of Christ and the final judgment.

title: The David
description: A marble sculpture depicting the biblical hero David, known for its exceptional detail and representation of human anatomy.

title: Primavera
description: A large-scale mythological painting depicting a group of mythological figures in a springtime garden, symbolizing the arrival of spring and the rebirth of nature.

title: The Calling of St. Matthew
description: A dramatic painting depicting the biblical scene of Jesus calling St. Matthew to become one of his disciples.

title: The Ecstasy of St. Teresa
description: A sculptural group representing the mystical experience of St. Teresa of Avila, depicting her in a state of spiritual ecstasy.

title: The Night Watch
description: A famous group portrait of a city militia, known as the "Night Watch," showcasing Rembrandt's mastery of light, shadow, and characterization.

title: The Conversion of St. Paul
description: A powerful painting depicting the moment of St. Paul's conversion on the road to Damascus, with intense light and dramatic realism.

title: The Raising of the Cross
description: A monumental altarpiece depicting the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, displaying Rubens' dynamic composition and use of color.

title: The Coronation of the Virgin
description: A painting depicting the coronation of the Virgin Mary in heaven, showcasing Velázquez's mastery of light and shadow.

title: The Allegory of the Faith
description: A symbolic painting representing the virtue of faith, featuring a female figure holding a chalice and a Bible.

title: The Triumph of Bacchus
description: A lively and festive painting depicting the Roman god Bacchus (Dionysus) surrounded by revelers and wine.

title: The Sacrifice of Isaac
description: A dramatic painting illustrating the biblical story of Abraham's willingness to sacrifice his son Isaac, showcasing Caravaggio's use of chiaroscuro.

title: The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp
description: A group portrait depicting Dr. Nicolaes Tulp demonstrating a dissection to fellow surgeons, highlighting Rembrandt's mastery of portraiture and lighting effects.

title: The Death of Marat
description: A powerful and iconic painting depicting the murdered French revolutionary leader Jean-Paul Marat in his bathtub.

title: Oath of the Horatii
description: A monumental painting depicting a scene from Roman history, showcasing the oath-taking ceremony of the Horatii brothers.

title: The Sleep of Reason Produces Monsters
description: An etching from Goya's series of prints titled "Los Caprichos," depicting a man asleep at his desk surrounded by ominous creatures.

title: Napoleon Crossing the Alps
description: A grandiose painting portraying Napoleon Bonaparte on horseback crossing the Alps, symbolizing his military prowess.

title: The Third of May 1808
description: A monumental painting depicting the execution of Spanish civilians during the Peninsular War, showcasing Goya's anti-war sentiment.

title: Cupid and Psyche
description: A marble sculpture depicting the mythological lovers Cupid and Psyche in an embracing pose, showcasing Canova's mastery of sculptural drapery and anatomy.

title: The Raft of the Medusa
description: A monumental painting depicting the tragic aftermath of the shipwreck of the French naval frigate Medusa, showcasing the struggles and despair of the survivors.

title: The Emperor Napoleon in His Study at the Tuileries
description: A portrait of Napoleon Bonaparte in his study, capturing the emperor's intense gaze and reflective mood.

title: The Coronation of Napoleon
description: A monumental painting depicting the coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte and Empress Josephine in Notre-Dame Cathedral, Paris.

title: The Hay Wain
description: A landscape painting depicting a hay wain (cart) by a river, showcasing Constable's meticulous attention to detail and his love for the English countryside.

title: Wanderer above the Sea of Fog
description: A powerful landscape painting depicting a solitary figure standing on a rocky precipice, gazing into a vast and mysterious sea of fog.

title: Liberty Leading the People
description: A monumental painting depicting Liberty as a female allegorical figure leading the people during the French Revolution of 1830.

title: The Nightmare
description: A haunting and surreal painting depicting a woman lying on a bed while a demonic figure sits atop her, portraying a dream-like and nightmarish scene.

title: The Fighting Temeraire
description: A stunning seascape painting depicting the decommissioned warship HMS Temeraire being towed by a steam-powered tugboat, symbolizing the decline of the age of sail.

title: The Slave Ship
description: A powerful and evocative painting depicting a slave ship caught in a storm, with enslaved Africans being thrown overboard, highlighting the cruelty of the slave trade.

title: The Slave Market
description: A thought-provoking painting depicting a scene at a slave market in ancient Rome, highlighting the inhumanity and dehumanization of the slave trade.

title: The Fighting Cocks
description: A dynamic painting capturing a fierce fight between two roosters, showcasing Homer's skill in portraying movement and the intensity of the scene.

title: The Oxbow
description: A panoramic landscape painting depicting a bend in the Connecticut River, showcasing the contrasting forces of civilization and untamed wilderness.

title: The Execution of Lady Jane Grey
description: A poignant historical painting depicting the execution of Lady Jane Grey, the short-lived Queen of England, conveying her tragic fate and the human drama surrounding her.

title: The Evening Star
description: A contemplative landscape painting depicting a solitary figure standing on a hill, gazing at the evening star, symbolizing introspection and the sublime beauty of nature.

title: The Gleaners
description: A poignant painting depicting three peasant women gleaning the leftover grain in a field, emphasizing the hardships and dignity of rural laborers.

title: The Stone Breakers
description: A raw and gritty portrayal of two laborers, one young and one old, breaking stones on the roadside, symbolizing the harsh reality of manual labor

title: Olympia
description: A provocative and controversial painting depicting a reclining nude woman, challenging traditional artistic conventions and social norms.

title: A Burial at Ornans
description: A monumental painting depicting a funeral scene in a small French village, capturing the ordinary lives and emotions of the local people.

title: The Railway
description: A snapshot-like painting capturing a modern urban scene with a young woman and a little girl waiting on a train platform, highlighting the effects of industrialization on society.

title: The Horse Fair
description: An impressive and meticulously detailed painting depicting a lively horse market, showcasing the artist's skill in capturing the power and grace of these magnificent animals.

title: The Third-Class Carriage
description: A compassionate and empathetic portrayal of the passengers in a third-class railway carriage, shedding light on the social inequalities and struggles of the working class.

title: The Angelus
description: A contemplative painting featuring two peasants in a field pausing to say a prayer at the sound of the evening church bell, reflecting on the spiritual devotion and rural life.

title: The Grain Sifters
description: A realistic and detailed portrayal of three women engaged in the task of sifting grain, illustrating the labor-intensive nature of rural work.

title: The Absinthe Drinker
description: A somber and melancholic portrayal of a man sitting in a café, consumed by the vice of absinthe, capturing the darker aspects of contemporary urban life.

title: Impression, Sunrise
description: A groundbreaking painting that gave the Impressionist movement its name, depicting a hazy and atmospheric sunrise over the port of Le Havre

title: A Bar at the Folies-Bergère
description: A complex and enigmatic painting depicting a barmaid at the famous Folies-Bergère nightclub, capturing the bustling atmosphere and the reflection of the scene in a mirror.

title: Water Lilies
description: A series of paintings depicting Monet's water garden at his home in Giverny, showcasing his fascination with light, color, and the reflections on the water's surface.

title: Dance at the Moulin de la Galette
description: A lively and joyous painting capturing a crowd of people dancing and enjoying themselves at the popular Moulin de la Galette dance hall in Montmartre.

title: Starry Night Over the Rhône
description: A mesmerizing nocturnal scene depicting the reflection of stars in the Rhône River, showcasing van Gogh's distinctive brushwork and vibrant color palette.

title: Woman with a Parasol
description: A captivating portrait of Monet's wife and son captured in a candid moment, featuring the play of light and the subtle effects of the wind on their clothing.

title: The Dance Class
description: A glimpse into a ballet dance class, capturing the fluid movements and grace of the dancers, showcasing Degas' fascination with the subject and his mastery of capturing movement.

title: Bridge Over a Pond of Water Lilies
description: An exquisite painting featuring a Japanese bridge over a pond covered in water lilies, showcasing Monet's fascination with nature and his exploration of light and color.

title: The Luncheon on the Grass
description: A controversial and provocative painting featuring a female nude and two fully dressed men having a picnic in a contemporary setting, challenging traditional conventions.

title: Dancers in Blue
description: "Dancers in Blue" is a captivating painting that portrays a group of ballet dancers in graceful motion. Degas, known for his fascination with dance and the human form, skillfully captures the fluidity and elegance of the dancers' movements. The blue hues used in the painting create a serene and dreamlike atmosphere.

title: The Thinker
description: An iconic bronze sculpture depicting a seated figure lost in contemplation. "The Thinker" represents the power of human intellect and philosophical introspection, showcasing Rodin's mastery of capturing human emotion and form.

title: Les Demoiselles d'Avignon
description: A groundbreaking and influential work that marked the beginning of Cubism. "Les Demoiselles d'Avignon" portrays five female figures with fragmented and distorted forms, challenging traditional notions of perspective and representation.

title: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
description: A monumental pointillist painting depicting a leisurely scene along the Seine River, showcasing Seurat's meticulous technique of using small dots of color. The artwork captures the essence of modern urban life and represents a landmark in Neo-Impressionism.

title: The Starry Night
description: An iconic and emotionally charged painting depicting a swirling night sky filled with stars above a tranquil village. Van Gogh's bold brushwork and expressive colors convey his unique perspective and deep connection with nature.

title: The Scream
description: A haunting and iconic representation of existential angst, featuring a figure on a bridge screaming against a backdrop of a blood-red sky. "The Scream" is a powerful symbol of human anxiety and emotional turmoil.

title: The Night Café
description: A vivid and evocative painting portraying a nighttime café interior with vibrant colors and contrasting light and shadow. Van Gogh's expressive brushwork and intense use of color convey a sense of isolation and emotional intensity.

title: The Yellow Christ
description: A symbolic and spiritually charged painting depicting the crucifixion of Christ with a vibrant yellow background. Gauguin's work combines elements of Symbolism and Synthetism, exploring themes of faith, spirituality, and the human condition.

title: Mont Sainte-Victoire
description: A series of landscape paintings capturing Mont Sainte-Victoire, a mountain in Provence, France. Cézanne's explorations of form, color, and perspective in these artworks laid the foundation for the development of Cubism.

title: Tahitian Women on the Beach
description: A vibrant and exotic portrayal of two Tahitian women relaxing on a beach. Matisse's use of bold colors, simplified forms, and decorative patterns reflects his fascination with the exotic and his exploration of non-Western art influences.

title: La Parade
description: A powerful and emotionally charged painting depicting a parade of circus performers, clowns, and musicians. Rouault's use of bold, dark outlines and expressive brushwork conveys a sense of tragedy, highlighting the marginalized and the human condition.

title: The Persistence of Memory
description: An iconic painting featuring melting clocks draped over various objects, set against a dreamlike landscape. "The Persistence of Memory" explores Dalí's fascination with the fluidity of time and the subconscious mind.

title: The Elephants
description: A surreal composition depicting elephants with elongated legs and thin, spindly bodies, set against a barren landscape. The artwork evokes a sense of mystery and invites viewers to interpret its symbolic meaning.

title: The Son of Man
description: A thought-provoking painting featuring a man in a suit, with a green apple obscuring his face. "The Son of Man" challenges the viewer's perception and explores themes of identity, concealment, and hidden truths.

title: The Treachery of Images
description: A surrealist artwork featuring a painting of a pipe with the text "Ceci n'est pas une pipe" (This is not a pipe) written below it. Magritte questions the relationship between representation and reality, challenging viewers' assumptions.

title: The Accommodations of Desire
description: A surrealistic painting featuring a barren landscape with floating rocks and the silhouette of a couple embracing. "The Persistence of Desire" explores Dalí's fascination with desire, love, and the human psyche.

title: The Lovers
description: A mysterious painting depicting two lovers embracing, with their faces obscured by white cloth. Magritte's work often plays with the juxtaposition of ordinary objects in unusual contexts, inviting multiple interpretations.

title: The Human Condition
description: A surrealist painting featuring an easel holding a canvas depicting a landscape that aligns perfectly with the view through a window. "The Human Condition" explores the relationship between art, representation, and reality.

title: The Temptation of Saint Anthony
description: A surrealistic artwork portraying the temptation of Saint Anthony by strange and fantastical creatures. Dalí's painting captures the hallucinatory nature of dreams and the subconscious mind.

title: The False Mirror
description: A surrealist painting featuring a giant eye with a cloudy sky and the sea reflected in the iris. "The False Mirror" challenges the viewer's perception of reality and raises questions about the nature of vision and representation.

title: Metamorphosis of Narcissus
description: A symbolic artwork depicting Narcissus, the mythological figure, transformed into a hand holding an egg, with a landscape reflected in the egg. Dalí's painting explores themes of self-reflection, transformation, and the unconscious.

title: Campbell's Soup Cans
description: A series of 32 paintings featuring Campbell's Soup cans, each representing a different soup flavor. Warhol's work explores consumer culture, mass production, and the blurring of art and everyday objects.

title: Whaam!
description: A large-scale painting depicting an intense aerial combat scene, inspired by comic book panels. Lichtenstein's work draws on the visual language of popular culture and challenges traditional notions of fine art.

title: Drowning Girl
description: A vibrant painting featuring a distressed woman with a speech bubble that reads, "I don't care! I'd rather sink—than call Brad for help!" Lichtenstein's work often appropriates and recontextualizes comic book imagery.

title: Marilyn Diptych
description: A large-scale artwork featuring multiple repetitions of Marilyn Monroe's face, with some images in color and others in black and white. Warhol's piece explores themes of fame, celebrity culture, and mortality.

title: Just What Is It That Makes Today's Homes So Different, So Appealing?
description: A collage artwork depicting a modern domestic scene with various consumer products and popular culture references. Hamilton's work critiques the materialism and media-saturated society of the time.

title: Oh, Jeff... I Love You, Too... But...
description: A stylized painting depicting a distressed woman speaking to a man, with a speech bubble that reads, "Oh, Jeff... I love you, too... but..." Lichtenstein's work often explores themes of love, romance, and communication.

title: Target
description: A painting featuring a target motif in bold colors, rendered with textured brushwork. Johns' work blurs the boundaries between fine art and common signs and symbols.

title: Nine Jackies
description: A series of nine silk-screened portraits of Jacqueline Kennedy, each representing a different color combination. Warhol's piece reflects on the media's coverage of Jacqueline Kennedy following the assassination of JFK.

title: Flag
description: A painting depicting the American flag with textured brushwork and layers of encaustic wax. Johns' work explores themes of identity, patriotism, and the symbolism of the flag.

title: Banana
description: A large-scale sculpture depicting a banana, typically made from vinyl or other materials. Oldenburg's work often takes ordinary objects and enlarges them, transforming them into playful and unconventional artworks.
